subject: Re: [junit] how to set up ant to run the junit task?
msgSnippet: ... Just place optional.jar into /lib.  The ant launcher scripts, like ant.bat , include all jar files in that directory on the classpath when
messageBody:
At 06:58 PM 1/25/01 , Peter Bismuti wrote:
>
> How do you set up Ant to run the junit task? I have the optional.jar file.
> A reference to some docs would be sufficient.


Just place "optional.jar" into <ANT_HOME>/lib. The ant launcher scripts, like
"ant.bat", include all jar files in that directory on the classpath when
running ant.

If you got the release version of Ant, the docs should have been installed in
<ANT_HOME>/docs. You want "junit.html". There's also a link to it from
"index.html", at the bottom of the page, under "Optional Packages".

John Brewer
Jera Design
